topic.title: Couchbase Passwords
topic.shortdesc: Use of passwords is an important security measure in Couchbase.

ul.li: Administrative passwords for Couchbase administrators and LDAP administrators
Bucket passwords to secure data access to each bucket

body.p: As a security best practice, choose passwords that are strong and periodically updated:

ul.li: To be strong, a password should have at least eight characters, including characters from three of the following five groups: lowercase letters; uppercase letters; numbers; symbols; unicode characters.
Passwords should be rotated periodically, based on an organization's requirements.
CRAM-MD5 is deprecated in Couchbase Server version 4.5. Use SCRAM-SHA enabled SDKs instead. See these two blogs for more information: , .

body.p: You can reset any forgotten administrative passwords using the couchbase-cli reset-admin-password command.
